result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica Bonnie Barry

records.addlTxt: To Ct from DOC requesting an extension to file PSI report
ACJ payment receipt, Bail Bond Info Sheet from ACJ, Notice RE Posting Bond form and a copy of signed cash bond
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:14 AM Defendant Jessica Bonnie Barry appeared by video from home.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jessica Bonnie Barry.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF198, 22CF74, 22CF85, and 22CF84.  Parties have a plea agreement.  PLQ filed in questions.  Def understands charges and potential penalties, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied.  Def waives right to personal appearance, court accepts.  21CF198 - Atty, def pleads GUILTY CT 1, def agrees, Court finds factual basis, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  22CF74 - Atty, def pleads GUILTY CT 1 and 2, def agrees, Court finds factual basis, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  22CF84 - Atty, def pleads GUILTY CT 2, Court finds factual basis, finds GUILTY and direct judgment enter.  22CF85 - Atty, def pleads GUILTY, def agrees, Court finds factual basis, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.   All parties agree factual basis exists.  State requesting immediate report to jail.  Atty, def never reported to treatment facility, and posted bond.  Def posted bond and called for a new bed date.  State, sees no record of receipt for bond posted.  Court, def needs to report to jail today, has till 5pm today to figure out bond issue and if not needs to turn herself in.  PSI ordered for each case.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:10 am.

1:18 PM Defendant Jessica Bonnie Barry appeared by video, in custody from Oneida County.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jessica Bonnie Barry.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF198, 22CF74, 22CF84, and 22CF85.  State in reviewing cases, appears no initial appearance 22CF74, 22CF84, or 22CF85.  Does believe there is an agreement.  Atty, ask to enter pleas and schedule sentence date, request to release to bed.  State request to confirm circumstances of treatment as to what type of facility it is, pending that confirmation state opposes but if provided will re-evaluate position.  Atty comments treatment is New Day Center in Michigan.  Parties will ask for PSI.  State, cap request at 12 months of jail on CT1 in 21CF198. 
22CF74, 22CF84, and 22CF85 - Atty, def has received copies of complaints, waives right to prelim hearing, def agrees, Atty satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waivers.  State filing information for each case now, contains the same charges.  PLQ filed in each case.  State sent revised offer to settle to Atty.  
Atty - asking to modify bond to report to treatment center and if completes program or is released is to report back to jail.  State just reached letter.  Atty, would be treatment for addiction.  Def comments that is both mental health and addiction treatment.  State, does not oppose to treatment.  Court grants change in bond to allow to be release to go directly to treatment program and as soon as treatment concludes def is to report directly to ACJ.  State, does not agree that treatment program constitutes any jail credit, order to be given to jail 5 days prior to release from program so transportation can transport back to jail.  Court orders bond be modified to allow def to enroll in program, allowed to go for 6 weeks, Kathy Schutte to take and return back to jail when done and jail be given 5 days notice prior to release date, def to arrange to have pick, drivers to have copy of this order, condition of bond and an order as well.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:10 am.

11:05 AM Prosecuting attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jessica Bonnie Barry appeared by video, in custody in Oneida Co jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jessica Bonnie Barry.  22cf85,22CF84,22CF74,21CF77--  21CF77 is a closed case.. State comments on item to be returned. Should not be schd. for a hearing. 
22CF74,22CF84,22CF85-- Atty is not on any of the newest cases, nothing from the SPD that the def contacted them. Def comments, did talk with SPD  and they were going to reach out to Atty Erdman. Atty Erdman will take the cases if the SPD contacts her. Bail is set on 74 and 84-- State comments on bail in 22cf85-- was not covered under the bail that was set for 74 and 84. Atty comments-- will go forward with INIT in all three cases. State comments on bail/bond. Atty comments on bail/bond
Ct orders-- 22CF85-- added to current bail/bond in 22CF74 and 22CF84. 
Atty will file motion for bail/bond. Will adj init
